citation.article-title: Jejuia pallidilutea gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Jejuia pallidilutea sp. nov.
Jejuia pallidilutea (pal.li.di.lu′te.a. L. adj. pallidus pale; L. adj. luteus orange; N.L. fem. adj. pallidilutea pale orange, referring to the colony colour).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 0.5–0.7 μm wide and 1.8–2.6 μm long.
Colonies on MA are pale orange, low convex and circular with entire margins.
Growth occurs at 15–35 °C (optimum, 25–30 °C), at pH 6.5–9.0 (optimum, 7.0–8.5) and in the presence of 1–6 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 2–4 %).
Anaerobic growth is not observed after 15 days at 30 °C on MA.
Aesculin, Tween 20, Tween 80 and starch are hydrolysed.
Casein, tyrosine, urea, carboxymethylcellulose and gelatin are not hydrolysed.
Acid is produced from lactose, melibiose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-galactose and d-mannitol, but not from raffinose, myo-inositol, l-arabinose or arbutin.

Using the API ZYM kit, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are present, but trypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase and α-mannosidase activities are absent; weak enzymic activities are observed for lipase (C14) and α-fucosidase.

Resistant to polymyxin B (100 U), streptomycin (50 μg), ampicillin (10 μg), gentamicin (30 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg) and carbenicillin (100 μg), but sensitive to penicillin G (10 U), chloramphenicol (100 μg), lincomycin (15 μg) and novobiocin (50 μg).

The major (>5 % of the total fatty acids) cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 1 G, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH, iso-C16 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 1 A and summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The type strain, EM39T (=KCTC 22298T=DSM 21165T) was isolated from seawater from the eastern coast of Jeju Island in Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 34.6 mol% (HPLC).
